p:
The authors support the inclusion of anti-HBs in the serological screening markers (HBsAg, anti-HBc) as suggested by recent American Association for the Study of Liver Diseases (AASLD) and European Association for the Study of the Liver (EASL) guidelines,
10, 11 in order to identify cases that may benefit from initial or booster vaccination, but also cases of occult HBV infection in anti-HBs positive patients that have not been vaccinated in the past and have lost their anti-HBc.
